title: 107_s1134
content: The Act may be cited as the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" and includes modifications applicable to qualified small business stock. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments such as the repeal of minimum tax preference, an increase in the rollover period for qualified small business stock from 60 days to 180 days, and a reduction in the holding period for gains from certain small business stock. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce the holding period for gains from certain small business stock from 5 years to 3 years. Additionally, the per-issuer limitation on taxpayer's eligible gain is repealed, and modifications are made to the definition of qualified trade or business. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce the holding period for gains from certain small business stock from 5 years to 3 years. Other modifications include repealing the working capital limitation and providing exceptions from redemption rules for purchases with a business purpose. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock from 50% to 100%. Additionally, there are conforming amendments made to other sections of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to 100%. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code, including redesignating paragraphs and updating section headings. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to 100%. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code, including removing the "Partial" designation in section 1202 and replacing it with "100-percent". Additionally, stock held among members of a controlled group is not eligible for the exclusion. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to $300,000,000. Stock held by members of a controlled group is not eligible for the exclusion. The exclusion for gain from certain small business stock is increased to $300,000,000 for stock issued after 2002. The amount is adjusted annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. The amendments apply to stock issued after the enactment of the Act.
